COMMENT_TX: $Collins swung at and missed a pitch that bounced in front of the plate and he reached first; the ruling was an error on the pitcher but no strikeout
$Rabbit Maranville was Boston's acting manager in game;. Ed Moriarty retired after this game to study for priesthood.
$Both runners were standing on third and Moore tagged out
$Brandt's hand badly bruised by Waner's hit
$Durocher hit a popup that Herman lost, but Moore had stayed at first; Cavaretta picked up the ball and handed it to Herman who threw to Jurges to force Moore
$Smith had hit but turned toward 2nd and was tagged out

$L. Waner held up in case ball was caught, but P. Waner came around 2nd and into 3rd, joining his brother; Lee threw to Hogan who threw to Coscarart who tagged L. Waner, but not P. Waner who was then trapped between 2nd and 3rd; Whitney made a bad throw during the rundown and P. Waner went back to 2nd safely
$hit om thigh, left game
Balance of game derived from newspapers.
Collins hit left-handed.
$Overflow crowd behind ropes in outfield
$Harnett tries to pick Jensen off third, throws ball into LF
End of play-by-play, rest deduced from newspaper stories
Need another out on the bases and no information Play is deduced based on the fielding stats
$Gomez failed to tag up and was out on appeal
$Birkofer left due to heat and running bases last inning
$Vergez threw home and Waner was in rundown, but returned safely; Vaughan kept running from 1st and came into 3rd; so there were two runners on the base; Vergez tagged them both and Vaughan was out
$Jordan fouled a pitch off his face and had to leave game
$Critz injured right shoulder on play.
$Hafey goes to 2nd on throw to 3rd and then to 3rd on Vergez's wild throw
$Lucas blinded by sun drops ball, called a triple
$Suhr, a first baseman, goes in to RF to preserve consecutive games streak
$Cardinals protested that the wild pitch hit Martin on foot
$Game called so Giants could catch train
